channel.title: 3. Types and Typeclasses on WY Computer Science
channel.description: Recent content in 3. Types and Typeclasses on WY Computer Science

item.title: Ch03 Quiz
item.description: Write a good (technically correct) type signature for f(x) = x*(x+1) g(xs) = [ x/7 | x ← xs ] h(x) = "You told me "++(show x) k(x,y) = y*x – 5 Write a function to extract an integer from one string and output a list containing the second string repeated that many times. prob2 "5" "dog" == ["dog","dog","dog","dog","dog"] Given two strings containing floating point numbers, return the sum of those numbers.

item.title: Chapter 3 Problem Set
item.description: The essentials of the Types and Typeclasses chapter are: writing type signatures for functions, reading string inputs with the Read class, and dealing with Integral to Fractional conversions when they are needed.
